title: Fairly heavy showers in parts of the island today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that  showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today (26).

title: Trump says he’ll delay threatened 50% tariff on EU until July
byline: President Donald Trump said Sunday that the U.S. will delay implementation of a 50% tariff on goods from the European Union from June 1 until July 9 to buy time for negotiations with the bloc.

title: Artists have ability to build cultural bridge between North and South, says President
byline: A meeting between President Anura Kumara Disanayake and the Joint Association of Performing Artists of Sri Lanka was held at the Presidential Secretariat, on Sunday (25).

title: Edu Min. launches probe into suicide by student of Wayamba National College of Education
byline: The Ministry of Education has launched an urgent investigation into the suicide of a second-year student at the Wayamba National College of Education in Bingiriya.

title: Trump says Putin ‘has gone absolutely crazy’ after major Russian attack on Ukraine
byline: US President Donald Trump has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin “has gone absolutely CRAZY” and that he is “not happy with what Putin is doing” after Moscow launched its largest aerial attack of its three-year war on Ukraine overnight.

title: Last rites of Malini Fonseka with state honours today
byline: The final rites of Sri Lankan cinema icon and veteran actress Malini Fonseka, widely celebrated as the “Queen of Sri Lankan Cinema,” is scheduled to be performed with full state honours this evening (26) at Independence Square in Colombo.

title: Special traffic plan around Independence Square due to funeral of Malini Fonseka
byline: Vehicular movement will be restricted in and around Independence Square in Colombo, due to the funeral of veteran actress Malini Fonseka scheduled for this evening (26).

title: Three arrested with heroin and ICE in Mount Lavinia
byline: Three individuals have been arrested for the possession of heroin and crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as ICE) during separate raids conducted in Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka Police said.

title: Ex-Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage brought to court
byline: Former Minister of Agriculture Mahindananda Aluthgamage, who is currently in remand custody, has been produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court by prison officials this morning (May 26).

title: Remains of veteran actress Malini Fonseka brought to Independence Square
byline: The mortal remains of late veteran actress Malini Fonseka has been brought to the Independence Square in Colombo for the general public to pay their last respect.

title: Special program honoring cinema icon Malini Fonseka live on TV Derana
byline: A special program dedicated to veteran actress and Sri Lankan cinema icon Malini Fonseka, fondly known as the “Queen of Sri Lankan Cinema,” is currently being broadcast on TV Derana.

title: Lilo and Stitch beat Tom Cruise in box office bonanza
byline: Disney’s live-action Lilo and Stitch remake and Tom Cruise’s supposedly final Mission: Impossible outing have opened as two of the biggest films of the year in a record-breaking weekend at the box office.

title: Viral video of assault on foreigner: Police issue clarification and warn against spreading old incidents
byline: Sri Lanka Police have issued a clarification regarding a viral video circulating on social media that appears to show a Sri Lankan man assaulting a Filipino national.

title: Former Minister Mahindananda granted bail
byline: Former Minister of Agriculture Mahindananda Aluthgamage, who was arrested and remanded in connection with the case filed over the importation of a shipment of substandard organic fertiliser from a Chinese company during the previous administration, has been granted bail, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: The first lady says AI is the future of publishing. It’s already happening
byline: First lady Melania Trump released an audiobook version in her voice of her memoir on Thursday — but she won’t actually be the one narrating it.

title: India overtakes Japan to become the fourth-largest economy: NITI Aayog CEO
byline: India overtakes Japan to become the fourth largest economy in the world, Aayog CEO BVR Subrahmanyam has said.

title: Legal action against 1,470 for maintaining mosquito breeding grounds
byline: Over 30,000 premises with potential mosquito breeding sites have been identified during the special island-wide mosquito control program conducted from May 9 to 24, the Ministry of Health said.

title: New Zealand welcomes Sri Lanka’s application to accede to RCEP agreement
byline: Visiting Deputy Prime Minister of New Zealand Winston Peters has welcomed Sri Lanka’s application to accede to the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) agreement.

title: President meets Lions Clubs Chief to strengthen youth mental health programs
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake met with Fabrício Oliveira, International President of Lions Clubs International, at the Presidential Secretariat today (26) to discuss strengthening collaboration on youth mental health and social welfare initiatives in Sri Lanka.

title: Funeral ceremony of late Malini Fonseka underway at Independence Square
byline: The funeral ceremony of Sri Lankan cinema icon and veteran actress Malini Fonseka, widely known as the “Queen of Sri Lankan Cinema,” has commenced at Independence Square in Colombo.

title: Colombo HC adjourns ‘Sathosa’ case against Johnston Fernando
byline: The case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) against former Minister Johnston Fernando and two others was taken up for hearing once again before the Colombo High Court today (26).

title: Police constable suspended following assault incident captured on video
byline: A police constable attached to the Gokarella Police Station has been suspended from duties.

title: Mervyn Silva, Prasanna Ranaweera and 3 others further remanded
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva, former State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera and three others arrested and remanded for allegedly selling a plot of state-owned land in Kiribathgoda to a private party by forging documents, have been further remanded.

title: Dy Tourism Minister responds to reports of ‘bikini ban’ in Arugam Bay
byline: Certain groups are attempting to undermine the tourism industry by spreading false information via social media, Deputy Minister of Tourism Ruwan Chaminda Ranasingha said while clarifying reports of a purported ‘bikini ban in Arugam Bay.

title: Indian Consulate Officer dies in road accident in Omanthai
byline: An officer attached to the Consulate General of India in Jaffna has died following a tragic road accident in Omanthai, Vavuniya this morning (26), according to Omanthai Police.

title: Parliament to debate Personal Data Protection Bill during next session
byline: Parliament is scheduled to convene from June 3 (Tuesday) to June 6 (Friday) according to Secretary General of Parliament Kushani Rohanadeera.

title: India’s Kerala state on alert after ship carrying hazardous cargo capsizes
byline: Authorities in India’s southern Kerala state have issued an alert after a ship carrying oil and hazardous cargo leaked and sank off the state’s coast in the Arabian Sea.

title: LG Polls: Deadline to submit campaign finance reports ends at midnight tomorrow
byline: The deadline for all candidates who contested the 2925 Local Government (LG) Elections to submit their campaign income and expenditure reports ends at midnight tomorrow (27).

title: Sri Lanka bids farewell to “Queen of Sinhala Cinema,” Malini Fonseka
byline: The final rites of Sri Lankan cinema icon and veteran actress Malini Fonseka, widely known as the “Queen of Sri Lankan Cinema,” were performed with full state honours this evening (26 May) at Independence Square in Colombo.

title: US first lady says AI is the future of publishing. It’s already happening
byline: US first lady Melania Trump released an audiobook version in her voice of her memoir on Thursday — but she won’t actually be the one narrating it.

title: Polish Foreign Minister to lead EU delegation to Sri Lanka
byline: Radosław Sikorski, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Poland, in the context of Poland’s Presidency of the Council of the European Union, will undertake an official visit to Sri Lanka from 28 to 31 May 2025.

title: Application period for re-correction of 2024 A/L results extended
byline: The Department of Examinations has announced an extension of the application period for the re-scrutiny of results of the 2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination.

title: New Zealand reaffirms commitment to expand financial support for Sri Lanka
byline: A meeting between Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs of New Zealand Winston Peters and President Anura Kumara Dissanayake took place this afternoon (26) at the Presidential Secretariat during Mr. Peters’ official visit to Sri Lanka.
